title.value: Score-Based Likelihood Characterization for Inverse Problems in the Presence of Non-Gaussian Noise
title.justification: The title summarizes the main idea and focus of the research paper.
title.quote: Score-Based Likelihood Characterization for Inverse Problems in the Presence of Non-Gaussian Noise

extractions.description: This paper introduces the Score-based Likelihood Characterization (SLIC) framework for resolving the difficulty of likelihood analysis in the presence of non-Gaussian noise by using a data-driven noise model. The method uses diffusion generative models to estimate the gradient of the probability density of noise and employs Langevin sampling for unbiased likelihood analysis. The effectiveness of SLIC is demonstrated using real data from the Hubble Space Telescope and James Webb Space Telescope.

type.justification: The paper conducts experiments using real data from Hubble Space Telescope and James Webb Space Telescope to demonstrate the effectiveness of its proposed framework.
type.quote: In this section, we present the results of our experiments to model and sample likelihood functions in the presence of non-Gaussian noise using SLIC.

name.justification: The paper focuses on improving the accuracy and precision of likelihood estimation in the presence of non-Gaussian noise.
name.quote: Our experiments show that by modeling the empirical distribution of noise and having access to differentiable forward models, it is possible to build accurate likelihood models for highly non-Gaussian noise, resulting in accurate inference without the need for major approximations.

name.justification: The paper addresses inverse problems by estimating model parameters in the presence of non-Gaussian noise.
name.quote: Our goal is to infer the parameters of the foreground model (mass, ellipticity, orientation angle, position x and y).

name.justification: The framework employs diffusion generative models to estimate the gradient of the noise probability density.
name.quote: Our framework, Score-based Likelihood Characterization (SLIC), employs score-based diffusion generative models [23-25] to estimate the gradient of the probability density of noise relative to image pixels.

name.justification: The paper uses Langevin dynamics for unbiased likelihood sampling.
name.quote: Afterwards, we can generate samples from the likelihood function using a chosen sampling method. In this work, we use the unadjusted Langevin sampling algorithm.

name.justification: The UNet model is used for estimating the score of the noise distribution.
name.quote: In summary, the method involves training a neural network model (e.g., a UNet [26]) using the score matching technique [27-29] to estimate the score of a distribution.
